tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel. Now his message is to the mountains of Israel.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: prophesy to the mountains of Israel
tn.text: God wants Ezekiel to speak to the mountains as if they were people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This is an expression of joy. It can be translated as "I am very happy" or "This is great."
This refers to the high mountains of Israel. AT: "The very old mountains."
"now belong to us"
AT: "Because you mountains have become desolate"

tn.ref: because of the attacks that came on you from all sides
tn.text: "because you were attacked from every direction" or "because your enemies attacked you from every direction"

tn.ref: you have been the subject of slanderous lips and tongues, and of people's stories
tn.text: AT: "People are saying bad things about you, and the nations are telling bad stories about you"
AT: "slanderous words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This continues Yahweh's message to the mountains of Israel. It may be helpful to use a verse bridge here, as the UDB does, to arrange the text in a more logical order. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]])

tn.ref: listen to the word of the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:01|6:3]].
"the desolate cities which have no people living in them"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the cities that people have left behind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"that enemies have stolen from"

tn.ref: a subject of mocking for the other nations that surround them
tn.text: "that the other, surrounding nations mock"

tn.ref: in the fire of my fury
tn.text: Yahweh loves Israel very much, so he becomes jealous and angry when other nations mock her. AT: "because of my intense jealousy" or "because of my very strong anger"
"and against all of Edom"

tn.ref: had both joy in their heart and disdain in their spirit
tn.text: The UDB reverses the order of these phrases. AT: "have insulted your Israelite people ... happily taken"
"with joy in their heart" or "while being very happy"
It is implied that their disdain is for Israel. AT "disdain in their spirit for Israel" or "while despising Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]
The word "Behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Indeed!"

tn.ref: In my fury and in my anger
tn.text: The words "fury" and "anger" mean basically the same thing. Together they emphasize the intensity of his anger. AT: "Because I am extremely angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: you have borne the insults of nations
tn.text: "other nations have insulted you" or "other nations have mocked you"
This continues Yahweh's message to the mountains of Israel.

tn.ref: I myself will lift up my hand to swear
tn.text: AT: "I will personally lift up my hand and swear." Lifting up the hand shows that he will truly do what he has sworn.

tn.ref: that the nations that surround you will certainly carry their own shame
tn.text: AT: "that people will certainly mock the nations that surround you"
The word "you" refers to the mountains of Israel.
This continues Yahweh's message to the mountains of Israel.

tn.ref: you will grow branches and bear fruit
tn.text: AT: "your trees will grow will grow branches and bear fruit."
The word "behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "indeed."
"I want to do good things to you." The word "you" refers to the mountains of Israel.

tn.ref: and I treat you with favor
tn.text: "I will be kind to you" (UDB)

tn.ref: you will be plowed and sown with seed
tn.text: AT: "My people, Israel, will plow your ground and sow it with seed." To plow means to cut rows in the ground in order to plant seeds in them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This continues Yahweh's message to the mountains of Israel.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: The cities will be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt
tn.text: AT: "Then people will live in the cities and will rebuild the ruins." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they will multiply and be fruitful
tn.text: "they will become very many people and have very many children"

tn.ref: you to be inhabited as you previously were
tn.text: "people to live on you mountains as they did before"

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
The word "you" is singular and refers to "the land of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you will no longer cause their children to die
tn.text: It is implied that in the past children died because there was not enough food in the land. Now the land would produce enough food. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This continues Yahweh's message to the mountains of Israel.
"other nations are saying to you mountains"
"You cause many people to die." The word "you" is singular and refers to the "land of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"you cause your people's children to die." It is implied that the mountains do this by not growing good crops. This can be made explicit as in the UDB. See ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: This is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: Nor will I allow you to hear the insults of the nations any longer
tn.text: AT: "I will no longer allow the other nations to insult you."

tn.ref: you will no longer have to bear the shame of the peoples
tn.text: "the peoples will no longer cause you to feel ashamed"

tn.ref: or cause your nation to fall
tn.text: "and you mountains make your nation suffer defeat" (UDB)
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: with their ways and their deeds
tn.text: "by the way they lived and the things they did"

tn.ref: Their ways were like the unclean menstruation of a woman before me
tn.text: "Their ways were as disgusting to me as the unclean menstruation of a woman"
the blood that comes out of a woman every month when she is not pregnant

tn.ref: I poured out my fury against them
tn.text: "I did things to them that showed how angry I was."

tn.ref: for the blood that they poured out on the land
tn.text: AT: "because they made the blood of many people spill onto the land" or "because they murdered many people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: and for their pollution of it by their idols
tn.text: "and because they defiled the land with their idols"
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about Israel.

tn.ref: I scattered them among the nations; they were dispersed through the lands.
tn.text: See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: they were dispersed through the lands
tn.text: AT: "I dispersed them through the lands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "the things that they have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"because other people said"
This refers to the land of Israel.

tn.ref: I had compassion for my holy name
tn.text: "I cared about my holy name." AT: "I wanted people to know that I am holy."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel, and he gives him a message to Israel.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].
AT: "because of you" or "in order to help you"
AT: "so that people will know that I am holy" or "so that people will honor me as holy"

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|06:07]].

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Israel.
"make pure water drip on you" or "throw pure water"
"all the things that made you unclean"
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Israel.

tn.ref: a new heart and a new spirit
tn.text: See how you translated "heart" and "spirit" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:19]].
"within you" or "inside of you"

This compares the people's stubborn hearts to hard stone. AT: "the heart that is as hard as stone." See how you translated "stone heart" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:19]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"your body"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:19]]. This is a heart that is not stubborn, but is willing to obey God.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:20]].

tn.ref: keep my decrees, so you will do them
tn.text: See how you translated "will carry out my decrees and do them" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:20]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:19|11:20]].
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Israel.
"I will call the grain to come." This phrase presents the grain as a servant of Yahweh. AT: "will cause there to be grain in the land of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: you will no longer bear the shame of famine among the nations
tn.text: "the nations will no longer make you feel ashamed because you suffer from famine"
See how you translated "disgusting actions" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:09|5:9]].
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Israel.
"for you"

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: let this be known to you
tn.text: AT: "know this" or "you can be sure of this." Yahweh says this to emphasize that it is not because the people are good that he will restore them. This phrase can be moved to the beginning of the verse. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The words "ashamed" and "disgraced" share similar meanings. Together they emphasize the intensity of the shame. AT: "So be very ashamed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"because of what you do"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: you will plow the ruined land
tn.text: "you will farm the ruined land"

tn.ref: before the eyes of all who pass by
tn.text: AT: "and all who travel in the land will see it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Israel.
The word "they" refers to the people who walk through the land of Israel.
"the ruins that no one lived in"
Possible meanings are 1) "that enemies had torn down" or 2) "that people could not get into." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: that I built up the ruins
tn.text: "and that I built up the cities that enemies had torn down"
"planted crops in the desolate land"
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel.

tn.ref: to increase them like a flock of people
tn.text: "to make them multiply like a flock of sheep." Sheep multiply very quickly. AT: "to make the people multiply quickly like sheep." ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
